org.mt4j.util.math
Class Vector3D

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D
Direct Known Subclasses:
Vertex
public class Vector3D
extends java.lang.Object

************************************************ Homogenous 3D vector class with 4 components, X, Y, Z and W.

Author:
Christopher Ruff ************************************************

transform

public void transform(Matrix transformMatrix)
Applies a transformation on the vector defined by the given tranformation matrix.

Parameters:
transformMatrix - the transform matrix

transformDirectionVector

public void transformDirectionVector(Matrix transformMatrix)
Transforms a direction vector, not a point. Ignores the translation part of the matrix

Parameters:
transformMatrix - the transform matrix

transformNormal

public void transformNormal(Matrix transformMatrix)
Transforms a normal or direction vector. This is done by multiplying the vector with the inverse transpose of the matrix.

NOTE: this is not cheap because a new matrix is created (copied) inverted and then transposed.

(If you can supply a precomputed inverted matrix yourself, write yourself a method that doesent do the invert() call :))

Parameters:
transformMatrix - the transform matrix

transFormArrayLocal

public static Vector3D[] transFormArrayLocal(Matrix transformMatrix,
                                             Vector3D[] points)
Multiplicates all Vector3D of the Vector3D array with the given transformation matrix, thus transforming them. Make a deepcopy of the vectors first if you dont want the originals being altered!

Parameters:
transformMatrix - the transform matrix
points - the points
Returns:
the transformed vector array

Parameters:
directionVector - the direction vector

length

public float length()
Calculate the magnitude (length) of the vector.

Returns:
the magnitude of the vector

lengthSquared

public float lengthSquared()
Calculates only the squared magnitude/length of the vector. Useful for inverse square law applications and/or for speed reasons or if the real eucledian distance is not required (e.g. sorting).

Returns:
squared magnitude (x^2 + y^2 + z^2)

distance2D

public float distance2D(Vector3D v2)
Calculate the Euclidean distance between two points (considering a point as a vector object). Disregards the Z component of the vectors and is thus a little faster.

Parameters:
v2 - another vector
Returns:
the Euclidean distance between this and v2

equalsVector

public boolean equalsVector(Vector3D vector3D)
Checks if the two vectors have the same components (XYZW).
Does NOT check for object identity equality!

Parameters:
vector3D - the vector3 d
Returns:
true, if equals vector

equalsVectorWithTolerance

public boolean equalsVectorWithTolerance(Vector3D vec,
                                         float tolerance)
Checks if the two vectors have the same components (XYZW) in the range of a specified tolerance.
Does NOT check for object identity equality!
NOTE: checks each component of the vector individually, so the overall difference might be greater than the given tolerance!

Parameters:
vec - the vec
tolerance - the tolerance
Returns:
true, if equals vector with tolerance

toArray

public float[] toArray(float[] floats)
Saves this Vector3f into the given float[] object.

Parameters:
floats - The float[] to take this Vector3f. If null, a new float[3] is created.
Returns:
The array, with X, Y, Z float values in that order
